intro: Phalaris ovata, commonly known as narrow-leafed windgrass, is a perennial grass species native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are typically less than 1 millimeter wide. The plant produces small, greenish or brownish spikelets that are clustered in loose panicles, and it blooms from late spring to early autumn. Phalaris ovata is often found in disturbed soils, along roadsides, and in meadows, and it is adapted to a wide range of environmental conditions. Its fibrous root system allows it to thrive in poor soil and withstand drought.
